justification: The authors note that the mortality-salience prime had "insignificant impacts on the Death Anxiety Scale (cf. Templer, 1970)" indicating they used this scale to assess participants’ level of death anxiety.

measured_by: self-report questions on frequency of thoughts about own death
justification: They controlled for "questions related to thoughts about own death" alongside the Death Anxiety Scale, showing this construct was captured with specific self-report items.

Participants "played standard gambles … to elicit the utility of health interventions"; "The point at which agents switched from A to B yields the … risk level … This point is the outcome in our analysis," demonstrating the task operationalises their paternalistic choice.

measured_by: motivation selection questionnaire (Would / Should / Myself / Feel options)
justification: After each gamble, participants selected the reason for their choice (e.g., "I feel the least uneasy …"), which the authors treat as measures of weak, strong, or affective paternalistic motivation.
